Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row ofdata.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY,SEIS_PLAN, SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC INTERPRETATION SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the set ofseismic data that is processed. This set may be derived from one or more otherseismic sets.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.4: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.5: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.7: INTERPRETATION OBJECTIVE; The objective for the seismic interpretation, suchas reservoir delineation, production evaluation, exploration etc.
Column Comment.8: INTERPRETED SET NAME: name of the interpreted segment.
Column Comment.9: INTERPRETATION TYPE: the type of interpretation, such as time, depth, amplitude,shifts etc.
Column Comment.10: SEISMIC PICK METHOD: The method that was used to make the seismic picks,such as automatic picking, manual picking, semi-automated picking etc.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.14: APPLICATION NAME: The name and version of the application that was made tocreate this pick.
Column Comment.15: POSITION: what position on the trace was picked, such as zero amplitude, peak,trough etc.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
